alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 3:04PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CHST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South-central Guam, mainly near Cross Island Road. * WHEN...Until 400 PM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM ChST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.6 to 1.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chalan Pago-Ordot, Yona, Hagatna Heights, Talofofo, Asan, Piti and Santa Rita. - Doppler radar shows a rapidli developing shower east of the Naval magazine. Areas between Route 8 and the southern coasts should monitor conditions as additional shower development may occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
